clinical_study.brief_title: ILM Flap Transposition Versus ILM Peeling for Macular Holes: a Pilot Study
clinical_study.official_title: ILM Flap Transposition Versus ILM Peeling for Macular Holes: a Pilot Study

lead_sponsor.agency: Vienna Institute for Research in Ocular Surgery

clinical_study.source: Vienna Institute for Research in Ocular Surgery

brief_summary.textblock: Patients with macular hole <400µm will be randomized for ILM flap Transposition and ILM Peeling for surgical repair of macular holes

detailed_description.textblock: Patients with macular hole with a diameter larger than 400µm have better sucess with ILM flap transposition, but there are no data published examining the outcome of macular hole with a diameter <400µm. Therefore, patients with macular hole with a diameter <400µm will be randomized for ILM flap transposition and ILM peeling for surgical repair of macular holes

primary_outcome.description: closure of the macular hole will be assessed

arm_group.description: vitrectomy with ILM flap transposition and gas-tamponade will be performed
vitrectomy with ILM peeling and gas-tamponade will be performed

intervention.description: during ILM flap Transposition, an ILM flap is placed on the macular hole
during ILM Peeling the ILM is removed around the macular hole

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- macular hole with a diameter <400µm
Exclusion Criteria:
- Prior ILM peeling
